description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**Advanced Freshman English - Spring 2021**

**Time:** Monday, 08:10-10:00                    **Classroom:** 公館 綜合館002

**Objectives:** This course is designed to support college freshmen in their use of **English language in an academic context** through **intensive and extensive reading** and **skill/strategy training**. In addition, it also aims to build student proficiency in the output language skills—**writing and speaking**—through a variety of activities that integrate all four language skills. Therefore, the main objectives of this semester will be to develop students’ **(1)** **fluency in critically expressing ideas** in oral and written forms in English, **(2)** **English presentation skills**, and **(3) autonomous learning skills**. In order to do so, there is a **five-pronged approach** to the course:

**1) Firstly,** the **course textbook** and **online practice website** consist of a purposefully structured skills and strategies program to **propel language learning** and **create independent learners**. Furthermore, the textbook helps improve **vocabulary learning, reading proficiency** and **develop practical critical thinking.** There will also be four **Chapter Reviews** to quiz student comprehension.

**2) Secondly,** over the course of the first-half of the semester, students will undertake one major **task-based presentation project using Powerpoint,** in which task groups, of no more than 3 students per group, are asked to **investigate areas and topics** that are **of serious interest to themselves**, and then **present their work** to the class.

**3) Thirdly,** students are expected to read extensively to improve their English reading, especially **Lexile books.** There will be a second **Lexile Test** to assess improvement which is expected to be 50+ points.

**3) Fourthly,** students will need to do at least **_12 hours_ of** **autonomous learning (one hour a week)** in total this semester. These experiences must be **proven, catalogued and/or recorded** and handed in at the end of the semester**.**

**4) Finally**, there will be extensive **writing workshops** in which students will be asked to write **two reviews and a short critical essay** based on class work

**N.B: All course elements will be evaluated and assessed for final grading.**

**Guidelines and Requirements: Only Eight Commandments!**

1.  **Punctual attendance** is essential. Talk to or email me if you can’t attend class or are late for class.

       2. This is a **Flip Class**. Homework and previewing must be done **before class** for the course to work properly.

       3. Actively **participate in class discussions**.

       4. You need to **submit work _several times_** during the semester. Task drafts, assignments, homework, and essays **must be done and be on time**.

       5. Smartphones, tablets, etc, must be **turned off** unless needed in class.

       6. **No eating** during class, but drinks are allowed.

       7. **English Practice**: Students should practice their English every chance they get, e.g. **Self-Access Room** (Main campus 樸101), **Workshops** (Main campus 樸102) and **NTNU             Competitions (FLED website)**. You need to do at least **_12 hours_** in total and **record this work for grading.**

       8. **Grades will be downgraded** for failure to attend class without reason, excessive lateness, lack of participation or failure to do homework or assignments on time. 

**Grading Policy****: The Business!**

Final grades are based and assessed on performance in the following:

**1)** Attendance and Participation: 10%

**2)** Chapter Reviews: 10%

**3)** Presentation Task Project: 20%

**4)** Book/movie reviews & critical essay: 15%

**5)** Self-access classroom/online learning/auto-learning: 15%

**6)** Lexile Reading Test 10%

**7)** Final Exam: 20%
